p: This problem becomes evident when the muscular abductor apparatus is injured when exposing the hip during total hip arthroplasty (THA). 1, 2 Rupture or destruction of the hip abductors can result in limping and predispose the joint to dislocation after THA. 3, 4 Any following revision substantially increases damage to the periarticular muscles. 5 Here, we used this highly standardized surgical procedure to assess a novel therapeutic option for muscle regeneration.
